cardinfo.CI: Euphorbia - Indian Spurge Tree/Indian Spurge Tree - Canopy.jpg

V: Indian Spurge Tree is a succulent plant with twisting columnar branches. It is often mistaken for a cactus. Leaves come out in the late summer/ fall. Flowers are small, yellow, like small buttons, alternating with the thorns, all along the stem, arranged spirally. This plant is native to India.

Common: Hedge euphorbia, Oleander spurge
Bengali: Manasasi, Sij
Hindi: Danda thaur, Danda thor, Sehund, Thor, Sij, Senhur, Katathohar, डंडा ठौर पेड़, थोर
Kannada: Elegalli, Elekalli, Ilaikalli, Gutagalli, Dundukalli elegalli, Dubbakalli
Malayalam: Elakkalli, Ilaikalli, Ilakalli, Ela-calli
Marathi: Mingut, Nevagunda, Newrang, Seej, Nivarang, Thor
Odiya: Thor, Kantalothor, Svarasana
Sanskrit: Gudha, Nagarika, Nanda, Nistrinsapatra, Patrasnuhi, Mahavrksha, Guda, Gandira, Adhoguda
Tamil: Elaikalli, Perumbu kalli, Nanangalli, Manjevi, Ilakalli, இலைக்கள்ளி மரம்
Telugu: Aku-jemudu, Akujamudu, Bonthajamudu, Akukalli
Urdu: Thuhar
